markdownRemark.html:
Writing for seven days straight formed a structure for me to remember that I need to write atleast something tonight…ß

Well, another loose blog where I try to atleast code into my neuro-pathway the memory of writing each day, like how I do cycling everyday as an encoded habit (have been doing it every single day even during 99% of the lockdown period…). Writing is unbelievably useful, that is why I force my brain and body a structure of breaking down ideas into letters, words, paragraphs, stories or blogs that eventually can make me a better communicator of ideas.

I haven’t seen profound effects of my writing except in my job here in Cayman Islands where my ability to be better at explaining ideas in emails or group chats. I had improved but not to a level where I can write a book or layout captivating blogs - I really do feel I have a shitty blog.

But even if this shitty blog is at its current form or state…it is a building block to getting better at it…this is the same pattern that was adapted by the greatest writers too - write all the time, whenever they can…it builds over time. Yes, incremental increase over time makes life better.

The truth is I still haven’t made the escape velocity of my dependence to my skills as an accountant but yeah, I am trying to punch a hole into other fields of expertise to somehow see what sticks or converge as combination of skills or produce opportunities to increase my resources.

This is not a bad blog post after all. Not bad for my 8th straight of blogging…
